definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: He liked to do everything himself or at least give it a shot.
sentences.chinese: 他凡事喜欢亲力亲为或者至少放手一试。

sentences.english: The highly intelligent orangutan is the ultimate do-it-yourself mom.
sentences.chinese: 猩猩十分聪明，是真正亲力亲为的母亲。

sentences.english: He urges you to "avoid the temptation to try and do everything yourself.
sentences.chinese: 他敦促你一定要“避免凡事亲力亲为的想法。

sentences.english: Learn not to take everything said or done too personally.
sentences.chinese: 学着不要任何事情不要过于亲力亲为。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
lit. things are not separated according to their size (idiom)/fig. to deal with any matter, regardless of its importance
to take care of a matter all by oneself/to run the whole show
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to do sth in place of sb else
lit. arm-flinging shopkeeper/fig. sb who asks others to work but does nothing himself
(idiom) take care of everything; handle everything
to think through/to invest effort in thinking about/to consider thoroughly
